intro: Esenbeckia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan esenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a clustered inflorescence, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Esenbeckia venezuelensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
